I received this dress much faster than I expected, considering it shipped to the US all the way from Asia.

I was a little worried about the size, but I followed the size chart provided and ordered larger than I normally would. I am 5' 9", 140 pounds, and normally wear US size M or L, depending on the measurements. I ordered the XL for this dress and it fits me absolutely perfectly. I really recommend you measure yourself and follow the size chart when ordering. The length is quite long, as pictured on the product page, so if you plan to wear it outside, make sure to either pin it up or be prepared to hold it. I wore it to the Renaissance Festival for my Galadriel costume and I ended up tucking it into a belt so it wouldn't get dirty. It is 100% white. Not cream, not eggshell. Pure white.

One thing I was surprised about is how soft the lace is. Some lace can be scratchy and rough, but this lace is like liquid against the skin. I'd definitely recommend wearing something under this gown, though. It is completely see-through and thin. I don't think that I would ever put this in the washing machine common not unless it was on the gentle cycle and in a delicate wash bag. The lace is so soft and kind of silky, I just don't even want to ruin that. This is going to be perfect for the summer time, it can also even be warn over a slip, or something else it's very form fitting like a bodycon dress, just to give it that perfect kind of layering effect. I would have absolutely no problem wearing a bodycon dress under this and having date night!!! I put a belt around it just to see what it would look like, because around the waist there is the stitching, and is not horrible looking at all, but if I was going to wear this to a date night, I would definitely want to throw a belt around it. Just to give it that extra added flair. I did show this to a really good friend of mine who is really into cosplay and she is in love with it. I'm really glad we aren't the same size... I think this is beautiful, I love the fact that it's versatile, there's so many different things that you can wear this with, you can dress it up, dress it down, go to the beach, lounge around the hotel pool looking all diva. I love it. I would definitely recommend this 100%. It's really well made, and the stitching is really nice, it's beautiful, and it's different. Promotional or discounted product provided to review.

Ok lol,  I'll start off with the fact that I do like this item, however, due to my body type there were some problem areas... I have an athletic build, and by that I don't mean that I have the body of a line backer haha. I just have more natural muscle, especially in my legs. My first area of issue are my shoulders, I do not have super petite narrow shoulders, but I also don't have broad shoulders either. If I were to try and hug somebody, my shoulders would rip the fabric. My second and last area of issue is my ass, which is quite pump causing the shorts part of the outfit to ride up. As soon as I start walking, or raising my hands, I get a serious wedgie in both areas, if you catch my drift lol... I will attach pictures so you can visually see what I am talking about. I will add that my height is 5' 2.75" so just under 5'3" and I weigh 130 pounds. I wear a size 2-4 (US sizing) in jeans, and a size small -medium in shirts, depending on the type of fabric. I also have an hourglass body shape.

I'm going to order this in a large or extra large, I originally bought a medium.

**Update, 3/9/16
I ordered a lg and the shoulders were a bit roomier, but still tight. My ass still made the bottoms ride up, and the waist area looked to big.

Honestly, if you actually have a plump ass, thin waist, athletic muscular  build don't get this romper. These are Asians sizes, so if you aren't built like one (meaning narrow shoulders, just a tiny frame all around)  spare yourself the time and get something else.

I really thought it would fit me because I'm thin, but clearly not narrow enough... Lol, oh well, I can't change that.

She is able to fit her 3 inch binder in but nothing else, so she will most likely have to carry that in her arms. Due to the amount of stretch in these, perhaps ordering a size down would be advisable.  I made the mistake of ordering a small instead of medium and they fit perfectly fine so this was a happy mistake.

Big Problem with zippers:  Each zipper has four bands or ribbons loose beneath the zipper.
Any of these four ribbons can easily get caught when zipping up.
Zipping up may be easy if no ribbons are caught in the zipper.
Zipping up may be difficult in various degrees to impossible, depending on how many of the four ribbons get caught.
Zipping down has the same risk factors
I fixed this problem by using a small scissors to cut out all eight ribbons--a laborious procedure.
These ribbons could have been sewn down during the assembly process.

I don't understand why this dress is being given such amazing views. The fit of this dress makes me look like I am PREGNANT. I am 5'9" and I typically where a size 6. I decided to purchase a medium in this dress which is what I normally wear because I have a bit of a butt going on back there. Lol...anyway,the dress is not well proportioned AT ALL. The part in the front that gathers the fabric at your midsection bunches up causing you to look like you have a pouch of belly fat. No woman wants to look like they have EXTRA weight in that area!!! The picture of the model as advertised for this dress is clearly posing forward. I'm assuming if she turned to the side,you would see the bunch of fabric gathered in her mid section. There is no way to truly "FIX" the issues with this dress. I tried. The only other option is to try and shrink it in the dryer but I'm not even sure if that will work. Its simply a poorly constructed dress that is not complimenting the female form. I'm convinced that you would have to try and singe the back of the dress to make it more form fitting and get rid of the pouch...but there is no guarantee that will work. Not worth the money I spent on it.

Exactly whats listed
Good quality

Great diffraction

These glasses are the bomb! I received them within a week after purchasing them. The diffraction is great, splits every light that you see through the glasses into every color in the spectrum, while also making somewhat of a kaleidoscope effect. This works best when either you or the light is moving. The only downside to this effect is that you will not be able to see around you (excluding the pretty lights) if you are in the crowd at a rave for example. This can lead to bumping into several people, like I did the first time using them. (I recommend rocking them almost librarian-style, low on the bridge of the nose so you can see around the frame of the glasses)
the mirrored outside is great, a perfect mirror, really. Nobody will be able to see your eyes. Trust me. They are of solid construction, much better than the disposable type of paper framed diffraction glasses, and completely worth the money. I highly recommend them. The only reason I cannot rate it as a 5 star item, is because when you wear them at a rave dancing can become difficult, because you won't be able to see the people around you. All around, the best set of diffraction glasses out there that I have worn. GLO HARD!

Standard diffraction glasses.  Product is as advertised.
Thank You Amazon For GloFX Metal Pilot Aviator Diffraction Glasses! They Rock!
summary: GloFX Metal Pilot Aviator Diffraction Glasses

reviewText: It's impossible to see anything with these. All diffraction glasses cloud vision a bit, but paired with the sunglasses, they're useless. But they do look good.

I thought these would be amazing since they're GloFX. The do look classy on, however they are dark like sunglasses so you can't see anything around you in an indoor edm show. It's very disorienting. And the diffraction isn't crisp. It just smears the image together with color so you can't tell what you're looking at. Sure there are more rainbows, but you have to be at the front of the stage in super bright light for these to be fun at all. I bought my friend a cheap pair of knockoffs that were really loved and passed around. No one wanted to use these. I would be returning them and getting another cheap pair for myself, but someone made off with them at the very end of the night.

They are comfortable but they are just aviator glasses with stickers on them. After the first day sweating in the sun at a music festival one of the stickers unstuck. The frame is a little too stiff too so they don't unfold easily
summary: You could probably make them yourself for $8 with a better set of glasses

reviewText: They work great, and stay on well while dancing unlike many other diffraction glasses. The diffraction film has a few bubbles in it after many uses, but they still work fine.
summary: They work great, and stay on well while dancing unlike many ...

reviewText: They are amazing because they look like Ray-Bans. They are SMALL tho.

The diffraction effect is awesome and the frames are sturdy enough for the price (needed a little adjusting right off the bat but nothing crazy), the only thing I didn't like is that the diffraction is apparently a sticker-like filter applied to the lenses, not an actual coating or the lens itself.  It doesn't stick perfectly evenly on the rounded edges of the lenses and will probably eventually come off somewhat.  Overall happy with this purchase.
summary: The diffraction effect is awesome and the frames are sturdy enough for the price ...

reviewText: This dress is adorable! But if you are on the taller side or have wider shoulders, make sure you order up a size from what you would usually wear. It will help you with the length and make it less clingy. I'm six feet tall and while the dress isn't technically too short to wear (it covered everything it needs to) it was too short for my comfort so I'll need to wear it with leggings. Which is fine because with fall coming up, it is the perfect season for leggings. The dress is pretty form fitting. It was clingy which would normally not be a big issue, but having recently had twins, the dress showed more of me than I would usually like. That being said, with spanx or other shapewear, it would have evened everything out. The dress itself is really comfortable. the stretchy material is soft and even though it is a bit thicker, it isn't too hot. Overall, a really cute dress that I look forward to wearing. I received this product at a discounted price in exchange for my honest and unbiased opinion and review.
summary: Perfect for fall with a pair of leggings

reviewText: My favorite wallet.

I used to walk around with a pile of cards in my back pocket. And I didn't really think there was that much fuss and aggravation sorting through them to get to the one I wanted until I got this. A decision spurred by the day I took the pile of cards out at my chiropractor's during treatment and managed to lose one.

It's small enough that it's not obtrusive, and basically takes up the same amount of space the pile of cards used to, which is exactly what I was looking for. It's also got exactly enough organization with the couple of pockets for me to have the 2 cards I use most in the outside pocket, 8 in the larger pocket on the inside, and the 2 discount cards I use the most often in the smaller pocket on the inside. I have my driver's id in the window pocket, and it wasn't one of those situations where when you have to take it out, you have to fight to get it out, so that's been very useful as well. I really like that I'm no longer concerned with whether I might have accidentally left a card at home when I don't see it right away - I hadn't realized how much I was doing that until I wasn't anymore. Because if I have the wallet, I'm sure it's in there.

Initially it was a bit bulky with all of that in it, and the flap wouldn't quite close when it was out of my pocket unless I laid it flap side down, but time in my pocket has worn it in a bit, the leather has done a bit of stretching, and the flap stays down now no matter what side is up.
Nice and compact.

summary: Don't be fooled by brand names. Best value.

reviewText: Love this little credit card holder. I bought it to fit in a very small square leather purse (5"x5"). On the inside, it holds my license and my husbands picture in the windowed slot,  my voters registration and AAA card in another slot and my health card and drivers insurance identification card and a restaurant card in the other slot. I currently have 12 bills folded in half that slip into the folded case perfectly. Will it hold every single card I own? No, but I don't need to carry more than this on a regular basis. I change the cards out when on vacation and just take what I absolutely need to take. It is made of a very soft leather. I do not know how it will hold up in the long-run but I would not hesitate to buy another when this happens.

And with there only being 4 pockets, changing over to the new one is a snap!

The is exactly what I needed. The size and smallness. I'm not the typically woman, I can't be bothered with purses, unless a specific occasion; the wallet is small enough to hold, work id, DL, credits, business cards and card; then fits in pocket. Perfect for my needs.

I like the soft leather and the style of this card holder, however there is no magnet inside to keep it closed once you fill it with cards! Also, the cards were normal sized business cards but it was very hard to get it to fit inside the open flap with clear plastic. Not a big deal, because that card is just for display, but this product could be a 5 star with some tiny adjustments. For the price, I'm not too disappointed, but I wouldn't recommend or buy it again.

reviewText: Both my husband and I have been using this particular model for years.  It has 4 separate dividers so I keep ID, credit cards, insurance cards and bank cards separate.

reviewText: The product was just okey, not that good. Hopefully they will change that its 100% leather as it is not.

The leather is soft and smells so good. I use this as a wallet so I don't have to carry a purse. It fits well in my pockets without a huge unsightly bulge. It holds my ID, insurance, discount, and credit cards perfectly. I put my emergency contact info/medicine list in the window pocket. I love it!!
It is a perfect size for what I needed it for. My other wallet hurt my leg. This one fits in any pocket and I hardly notice it.
genuine leather. good one. i gave mine to my brother so bought one online this one is better than the one i gave my brother.

My husband carries quite a few business cards, etc.  This wallet was PERFECT. It hold all his cards and he is able to fold it and put it in his back pocket.  I would highly recommend this wallet/card holder for anyone who needs more space!
Finally a billfold that will hold credit cards.  I don't carry pictures, but many business cards and credit cards. Works great. I recommend this to anyone needing a functional billfold.
I ordered two wallets at different prices to ensure that I got what I wanted.  They are both the same packaging and item numbers which is fine but one cost a couple dollars more...

It easily holds the 15 plastic cards (license, credit, debit, gift, membership, etc) and 10 business cards that I want to carry. I also used the external pocket for tucking in some cash.
The flexible part of the flap that folds over the large main pocket is a little too short, so it does not lay quite right and may bend anything you put in the window pocket. That is it's biggest design flaw. The leather and stitching aren't 5-star, but are certainly not bad.
Overall, it is the most functional wallet I've ever had. It is really cool that it can grow to hold more, or be super-thin when you don't need to carry much. When it is empty, it is the same thickness as my old leather money clip.
Update: I found that the stitching on the bottom missed the piece of leather it was supposed to hold in place, so the only thing holding the bottom of the wallet together is the nylon liner. That is a serious quality flaw. I still like the wallet, but it is falling apart due to this manufacturing flaw.

This is a wonderful credit card holder:
I got 2 of these and began to use one for myself. When my wife saw me using - she fell for it and immediately insisted that I buy one for her.
So I took out the other one and gave to her. She was really happy.
The business card pocket may not be very useful for persons who like to carry more than 20 cards at a time. I have ordered separate business card holder for her only.
summary: This is a wonderful credit card holder

reviewText: Good size for wallet reduction.  Seems well made, has a little bit of a smell but I am sure that is with any wallet and the smell will probably fade.  I am pleased with the price and the product.

I purchased this item and it has worked well and serves my purpose.  I would highly recommend.  The clock feature is nice and easy to set the date and time.

I've used a card case for years and finally needed a replacement. Once you "get used to" one you really don't want to change, but I was pleased by the quality of the leather and the fine stitching. Plenty of room if you need to carry a lot of cards too, as when going to a convention or into Asian markets, where business cards are a way of life. Running out of cards is not only insulting to those you meet but can cause ill will! I found it to be very usefull and nicely made.

I wanted a really compact wallet, that would allow me to have all my credit, debit, ID and membership cards a couple of bills and without leaving all the cards warped. And this one does it beautifully, the most compact wallet I've had that allows me to do this.

But then again it had a strong chemical smell that after nearly a month is starting to fade away, I did not attempt to use any cleaner to remove it, but there where a couple of times that the smell of the wallet when I had it beside me would give me a headache.

The design I think will allow this wallet to last a long time, and despite the smell, I'd get another one without giving it much thought, but will probably apply some leather conditioner or something to ease the smell a bit.
summary: Love the design, hate the smell, seems well constructed.

reviewText: A very nice quality wallet that fits easily in your back pocket without the monstrous bulge that so many men are guilty of when having an overstuffed, old and crummy looking wallet.  This is nice quality leather and well made.  It's dirt cheap, too.  Don't complain about slow delivery (about a week).  Considering it costs about $2.00, you're getting a lot of bang for you buck here.  I bought four.  I highly recommend this and the seller!
My husband just loves the size. Just perfect!! He just hate bulky bi-folds. I will be buying more of these for future use.

Very nice for the price. Quality can't be beat give the low price. Small and thin, the perfect everyday wallet for me. I will buy more of this for gifts and replacement when the old one gets all beat up.

Some have complained of a strong leather 'odor' accompanying this bi-fold. The scent is there, it's not overpowering, and I find it appealing. I'm glad it's made of leather, and not 'pleather', or vinyl, or whatever. It's buttery soft. Perfect size, too: I just put in half a dozen miscellaneous (credit sized) cards in one inside pocket, a small wad of cash in the adjacent one, a license in the windowed one, and half a dozen business cards in the outer pocket, and I'm sure I can fit more if need be. It's now about three quarters the thickness of a (soft, compressible) deck of cards. For five bucks? Are you kidding me? Exactly what I wanted at a price that's outrageously inexpensive for a basic leather accessory. I couldn't be more pleased.
summary: Affordable, efficient, genuine leather bi-fold for five bucks. *Nice*.

reviewText: For the money you never find a better credit card holder. I bought 3 of them and I am sure the others will be gifts. I just think I might be afraid to part with them.

I always use a small "pouch" or credit card holder such as this to hold my IDs, credit and debit cards, a few dollars in cash, membership club cards, library card, etc.  It's PERFECT for use in a purse or briefcase or to drop into a front pocket on quick notice when going to "riskier" places such as the sports stadium (come on ladies, when we don't carry a purse we greatly reduce the risk of purse snatchers and muggers.)

I would definitely purchase again, in fact I intend to have 2 or 3 on hand because the perfect "pouch" is always so difficult to find when needed.

It is made of tear-resistant nylon. It will protect your belongings from dirt, stains and damages. You can put anything with it, it is waterproof, the sizes are decent. Large at 9.8"x7.8", Medium at 7.8"x5.9", Small at 5.9"x3.10" It will allow you to organize stuff from tiny receipts to larger items. I love to organize my bag whenever we are travelling, and if you have a toddler . We usually just have 1 bag for the three of us to share, my husband , me and my son, and this is great for that. I usually use a packing cubes and each of us have a cube, and i intend to use this to put toiletries or undergarments bag to put in the cube, Or basically just whatever they want in their cube. I am pleased with this purchase and will purchase a different color next time. reviewText: I bought this item & only worn it twice and the wires are already coming out of it! I'm very disappointed!!

So far, so good! I'm 5'6" ish, 160lbs. Trying to get back in shape. I've had one child (4 years ago!), & I'm still carrying some of the belly. I've wanted to try these for a while, but only just recently started working out on a regular basis. Trying to eat a bit better. I read so many reviews, I decided to order up two sizes. I got the 3xl & I'm glad I did. It fits me on the first row, which is exactly what I wanted! I'm careful with mine because I've read other reviews about it falling apart or other issues. I figure, start out slow & work my way up. I don't exercise in it. I can lift weights in it, but I have no idea how people workout in these things! I haven't been able to use it on any kind of consistent schedule just yet. Kind of trying this on my own to see if it works, before I tell anyone. Lol. So, I try at least 4-5 hours a day, more if I can. I'm not sleeping in it at night just yet. Again, taking it slow. For the price, I say go for it! Seriously. I paid $9 something. That's it! If you still are not sure, I recommend trying the one Wal-Mart sells for $10 bucks. It's zippers though. Just fyi. You can at least see if you'd even like having something that tight on for long periods of time. I'll try to post pictures in an update, if it works.

i'm a 36x34x38. i ordered a large. it came on the first day predicted so that was super nice. i like the material. putting it on is HARD. and for a second you'll think it's not gonna fit. but once you finish clasping it firms you and tightens you. i'm currently on the loosest row so i'll be getting my money's worth.  if you're looking for absolute comfort you may want to look somewhere other than waist training but for the price i'm super happy. it's definitely long enough for my long torso. beware if you are slightly chubby or "soft" it's gonna roll or bulge a little. i paired it with my spanx underwear.

I need to wear it more but after two hours so have to take it off

I would only recommend wearing this only when you're going out somewhere and you're really trying to hide some belly bulge. And not for too long either. I started wearing mine an hour then gradually increased in hours a day. It felt tight and kept my bulges hidden well. However after one and half weeks of wearing it, it started becoming loose like it was stretched out so it then felt like I was just wearing an extra layer of clothing. And my bulges were no longer concealed anyway. I kept wearing it but you see these give you the illusion that it's actually resculpting your body into a "perfect hourglass figure" it's not. It's squeezing your water weight to give you that illusion. Also. It was very uncomfortable to lay in it (never slept in it, don't do that anyway it's not safe to) there were times where I had to immediately take it off to prevent fainting which I felt like I was going to had I kept it on. But the worst thing this corset trainer did was mess up my ribs. It's hard to explain but it pushed up a lot of my "fat" if you will (haha) up in2 my ribs that I never noticed until recently (1 and a half months of use in total) my ribs don't feel broken or anything but they feel more spaced apart and pushed upward. It's weird. I will not be purchasing one of these ever again. Ladies you're beautiful there's safer ways to go about this please be safe and exercise. A corset trainer is not worth the risk

I've only worn it for a few hours a day (2days), while working out, and haven't seen any results yet, which is completely understandable considering it's been 2 days, but I am looking forward to seeing the progress I make with this product!

I was thrilled to be receiving it, although I had read both good and bad reviews. I also thought it may be something different - something sexy I could wear around my boyfriend, that he may enjoy me prancing around in. To much dismay, he was not impressed. He literally never even noticed me. Mind you, I'm rather petite, 110lb, have had a breast augmentation, workout regularly and maintain a mostly healthy diet. I say all of this because regardless of what we look like, there will be someone who discourages you, no matter the effort you put in. Do this for you - no one else. And with confidence, you will feel beautiful.

reviewText: I'm happy with the size and fit of this waist cinched corset. It is breathable, so I didn't have to worry about overheating during a workout. The breathable material seems strong too. It hasn't ripped with me poking my fingers through it but I did break a nail getting it on :-) For reference, I am 5'1" and the length of this waist trainer worked great for me. The hook and eye closure hold strong and are easy to get closed. I ordered true to my waist size. The overall manufacture is done fine but I would suggest slightly stronger boning and a double stitch throughout (instead of the less secure single stitch) to take it up to the next level. Still, I think it works well as a starter waist cinching garment because it is relatively comfortable and thus easy enough to help you get accustomed to having a slimming garment on for a long period. It can also help to get you a better silhouette under garments but they need to be made of thick material to remain invisible under your clothes. I received this #SEXYWG product free in exchange for my honest and unbiased review. My reviews are done in compliance with FTC regulations and Amazon's TOS. I never guarantee a favorable review. I was expecting 3 hooks, because that was in the product  description. Yet, when I opened it, to my suprise it was 6!
I mesured my waist (above my belly button) and my waist is 29 inches. So I went with the chart they have and got a medium. Some people say to go down a size of shirts that you wear. For example, I wear a M in shirts, that means if I followed those guidlines I wouldve gotten a S, thank God I didn't.
I don't advise that method, its not accurate. I truly think yoy should measure yoyr waist and go with what it is listed.
Here is the pros:
Waist cincher has 6 hooks
Doesn't feel like its suffocating me
Got the correct size that I ordered
Looks exactly lijke the waist cincher in the picture
Now, the cons.
not made from steel boning (I cant see the what it is but it doesnt feel like steel boning to me, it feels bendable, like if I would bend it a lot it feels like it would snap)
Shaped wrongly (the boning is out of place,  it is not at each side of my sides which kinda defeats its purpose)

doesnt cover my back portion, meaning that my fat kinda muffins at the top

reviewText: Easy clamps

Great suspenders.

The combination of somewhat stretchy material, using Velcro to adjust size & the plastic grippers have perfected suspenders, finally.

The stretchiness of the straps keeps them on your shoulders while sitting.  I've always felt very uneasy sitting before this change.

The new grippers never fail.

The Velcro lets you make fast, easy adjustments as needed.

Perfect.

The good:
soft elastic and all plastic clamps of unique and working design. You can go through airports and metal detectors without issue. The clamp design is quite clever and works. IMHO it works better then the typical aligator clamps and does not require sewing buttons on the inside of your trouser waistline.

The not-so-good:
The elastic is a little TOO soft, especially for this out-of-style guy who still wears cargo pants and actually has some weighty things to put in them. I add my not-massive wallet and cell phone and the straps stretch a good inch. Lord help me if I had to use a wallet holster for a concealed carry. The adjustment is done ace bandage style, which means you don't get a lot of opportunities to readjust after setting the height - at least not without a lot of issues breaking the Velcro connections. At one point he elastic loops where stretched 1.5 inches away from the hooks and still not giving up holding the two sides together. If I wanted to adjust the braces a couple of times there might be some bare spots on the straps.
summary: Clever clamps that work, soft straps are a little weak.

I love these, no more dirty or frayed hems.

reviewText:
This adorable Meaneor Maxi Dress comes in four fashionable colors. I chose the black dress. It feels like its made with a Rayon and Spandex blend. The dress is very comfortable and soft against your skin. Its not too thin but not too thick either. You are not able to see through it. The material allows for a good amount of stretch.

The design of this dress is more of a high waist dress. The fitted top ends slightly below the bust area and not right underneath it. The skirt area is gathered at the top and has a slight loose fit flow to it. Im 57 and this dress hits right under my ankles. I love the  sleeves because I hate showing my huge arms.

Measurements for XXL

Bust: 18.5 across

Middle Bust/Waist Band: 16.5 across

Arm Length: 11.5 long

Arm Width: 5.5 wide

Overall Dress Length: 55.5 long

These are approximate measurements lying flat. The material does allow for stretch. I suggest going up at least one size large than you would normally wear. This XXL is like a US dress size 16.

Overall this dress is an excellent price. It gives you a long and lean look. This dress is very versatile. You can wear this casual with flip flop or dress this up with gorgeous jewelry and heels. It would be really cute with a fashionable belt or scarf. There are so many ways to change this dress up. The best part is, the dress is super comfortable. It seems to be great for all body types. I love my black dress! I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Comfortable & Versatile High Waisted Long Maxi Dress

Like the other reviewers said, this is a good quality costume but the fit is incredibly small. I normally wear a dress size 14-16 and bra size 38C and am 5'8". After reading the reviews I decided to order the largest possible size, 3XL, thinking that if it was too big I could have it taken in. Wrong! I can't even get the zipper up more than a few inches and there is no way it will close around my chest. Since I paid the expedited shipping fee and will now have to pay even more than that to return it (and Halloween only a few weeks away), I am just going to keep it and see what I can do. At least it comes with the cape so my patched up side zipper will be somewhat hidden. Again, great looking costume but if you are bigger than a US size L/ XL and have any sort of chest like me, this will not fit unless you get custom made!  :(

I was concerned about measurements and fit after reading all the mixed reviews on amazon, but the size chart they provide is true to size. My costume fits perfectly, and I am very pleased with the quality of the product. My recommendation to any future purchasers: Have a tape measure on hand and take your own measurements and compare it to the size chart. Choose your size from there. General "S,M,L" sizes in today's fashion industry are so varied. If you follow the size chart you should not be lead astray.

Thank you for the beautiful costume! I am so excited to wear it :)

reviewText: Wonderful shade of blue and nice manufacturing! The material is a nice mid-weight, not stretchy with a bit of texture. I am 5'4" and 130lb, ordered M and it fits very nicely. Wouldn't work well for someone who is busty however, I am 35 A/B and it works well without too much gap. Much bigger in the chest and it would get very snug! Don't forget, this is her riding dress, you need to wear leather (or suede) riding pants and boots as well :) Can't wait for cosplay!

Will definitely need some alterations. I'm 5" and ordered the XSmall. The length and waist were fine, but the shoulders and bust were way too big. Def not meant for a small framed upper body. Fabric is nice and looks to be well made.
This was a fantastic purchase!!  I wore this to a Halloween Party and won best costume!!!  Very well made, beautiful shade of blue! I am a size 6 and the Medium fit well! True to size.

I'm very happy with the quality of this costume, but the sizing is a little off. The fabric is the exact color in the photo and it's a nice medium weight, not too thin, not too heavy. Based on my measurements I decided to with the XL. I'm 5'7", 155lbs, 38D, 31" waist. The actual measurements I've taken of the XL is 35" waist and 37" bust, but the size chart says it should be a 33" waist and 40.5" bust. I'm okay with the waist being larger, but the bust being 3.5" smaller than I thought does not work for me. I can zip it up, but it's very tight and uncomfortable. Unfortunately, the fabric does not stretch at all, otherwise this may have worked. I've ordered the XXL to try next with hopes that the bust will be a few inches larger. I know this might mean the waist will be roomier, but I can always take that in. If the XXL fails, I may try to extend the bust of the XL on the left side. (Right side has a hidden zipper.) I'll have to talk to a seamstress friend to see if this is definitely possible, but looking at the seam it does seem like there is a little that can be let out - maybe an inch. As for the split in the front and back - yes this would show your underwear while walking, but if you look at the set photos of Daenerys she is always wearing pants and boots with this dress.  Hopefully this helps anyone trying to figure out what size to go with! Rough photos attached (mirror is dirty).
summary: Nice fabric, but the sizing it a little off

reviewText: The chest area is tight. The rest of the costume is a great fit.

reviewText: Arrived with prime in 1 day. Which is great! The material and quality are better than I expected. I read the reviews and knew it was running small. Size chart in the pictures state and XL fits a 38-39 bust, the one I received only measured 36. This is definitely going back. Just not sure if I should tempt it and go up a size or two or move on from this.

The material was okay for the look. However the sizing was all wrong. I got an Xtra Small following the size chart and the chest area was a size medium. I tried contacting the seller but the number on the card included was "no longer in service" and the email I heard no response from. The stitching was two different colors in the front and looked uneven. I am very UNSATISFIED with this item. I would have to take it to a seamstress to make it fit.

Someone needs to tell Chinese designers that plus sizes do not mean longer or taller. At 5'1" I will be hemming the entire costume about 10 inches. The size chart was not available in sizes past XL, so I had to guess the size I needed. It fit but was very long. The fabric quality was excellent and it was made very well.

Super fast shipping and product was even better than expected!  The dress and cape are thicker material than most costumes (not see through). I did order the XL- I am usually a size 10-12 dress, 5'7, and 158#. I almost ordered the Large but glad I went up a size (better to be roomy instead of too tight). Great purchase!!!

This costume is high quality, but sizing is off. I normally wear a 10/12 in misses, I had to get an XXL in this and the bodice is tight but just fits. The Cape ties at the neck and is lined, very cool, just be aware of sizing issues.

I love this costume! It's fits pretty nicely. I'm 5'6" and 130 pounds, I normally wear a 4 in dresses, and I ordered a size small. It's very cute! Just needs some irnoning because of wrinkles caused by the packaging. Other than that, seems like a high quality product.

I love this costume.  I think it is well made and looks quite close to the TV version.  I am 5'7" and usually size 8 to 10.  I ordered the extra large based on the size chart but it was a bit too large.  Then I returned it (with zero problems) and got the large, which fits just right.  I got it for Halloween, not for cosplay, so I am not that concerned with custom fit or perfect authenticity.  It also arrived really fast.

It honestly is really nice (I don't think it's worth $90 but still) lol gotta do what you gotta do but I love it. I thought it wasn't going to fit over my boobs bc I have DD abut I managed lol, its not stretchy at all just warning everyone. I got a medium and I'm about 130-140 pounds

Just came in the mail- so i'm a 35-29-39, 5'5" and 130 lbs. I  ordered the M and it's definitely more roomy in the waist and bust than i had hoped.  I also think the side panels are a tad too long- maybe overcompensation on the manufacturer's part due to complaints about the previous version being too short.  I also don't like the tie closure on the cape. The cape is lined so it lays nicely, but the dress is kind of cheapy Halloween type material, but it's better than what can be found at a big box store!

I think my seamstress can alter the sizing and the closure on the cape, but then again, i ordered it so far in advance, I'm tempted to return it for the S... I'll update on my decision and maybe pictures.
summary: Totally ok. Not great, not terrible.

reviewText: Runs extremely small!

For reference, my measurements:

Height: 5'2
Weight: 110lbs
Chest: 35.5
Waist: 30
Hips: 39

I ordered a size Medium and it was too large. It still works (see photo), but I would much prefer it be more snug and think I would have been better off in a Small.

reviewText:
I usually do not expect much from costumes. They are typically made out of cheap material and you will only wear them once. This is not homemade or tailor quality because the material is lightweight, there is no liner in the dress part just the cape part and they used white thread which shows up really well on the interior of the dress. It is made from a fair quality fabric. We like to attend renaissance fairs so I can feel comfortable wearing this multiple times throughout the year.

If you are looking for a high quality costume you may be disappointed but if you are looking for something better than Spirit of Halloween type this will be great.

Did she forget to put pants on!?" kind of way.  I'm 5'7" 140 lbs, with a relatively fit/slim build.

Otherwise looks amazing, kept me warm, and the material is even better than I expected.

Unfortunately, I'm not able to give a Negative star rating but I went through so much drama w/this seller. OVERMAL completely played me for a fool. This was my 1st jewelry piece off Amazon so I was excited buying something cute & not at all expensive--knowing it is a Costume piece & not "real". Reviews were more than good, so I was happy & took a chance. My Bracelet/ring was way to big, swirled all around & just had no practical use (It really was mis-shaped). Yes I did read the product description & still mine was off. So I did all the right things, followed the required steps (protocol) & had a few emails directly w/OVERMAL who right off the bat choose to reimburse me $5, w/out an issue. They then asked me for pictures, which I provided, but they must have not cared as my piece probably didn't meet their "whatever"....then changed their minds to reimburse me a $1 (which I didn't even get). The $1 was degrading. Basically it's not about the cost AT all, Customer Service should always be #1 & they definitely don't fall into that category.
** I since then have made numerous purchases from all different Sellers (from Jewelry to Art to Clothes....& my FAVORITE category: THE WALKING DEAD any items Sellers bring on) so if something comes damaged or not like it was advertised I do send them a professional comment. Every Seller has exceeded my expectations & been very helpful in every way.
** In no way am I being too picky (if I do order something that fit incorrectly, that's on me) but Sellers should know their buyers opinions, which is why Amazon has reviews, complaint/filing claims options and such (of course when an item comes damaged, it's complicated because it could be the Seller's packaging or our Delivery person just throwing the item.
**** HOWEVER, I LOVE & VERY SATISFIED WITH 99% OF MY BUYS & will try to get my positive reviews on their page as soon as I can.
Thank you.

reviewText: It's too big. It's attractive for a couple dollars of course but the chain that attaches the tip of the triangles is wayyyy too long. It sags majorly. I don't have particularly small hands and they're definitely not boney. I have about 1.5 inches more chain than necessary which causes the wrist piece to rotate underneath to the inside of your wrist instead of remaining on top of your wrist. Because of the loose flapping of the chain, it got caught on something and broke within an hour of wearing it. I'm sure I can cut a few links and reattach it if I care enough. The resizable feature on the ring hardly works. It closes smaller easily but extremely hard to loosen larger, and it tightens while you're wearing it and then you panic and struggle to get it off and it gets very pinchy in the process. I got compliments on it when I was carefully manicuring the chains and placement and keeping my hand very still, but anything with aztec angles/chevrons/and that's gold is cute in 2015. It was a cute idea but it is definitely worth exactly what I paid and for that I am not mad at all. I may work with it a little bit.

Had problems sent it back

I was hoping that this watch would be more stable and reliable compared with my Casio WV-200A which has a nasty habit of resetting itself for the hell of it. Unfortunately, this wasn't the watch that could beat the Casio.  After a few days of use, the Solar Atomic (which is a private label...you'll find look alikes with the exact design branded by others) started randomly advancing its hour hand by a few hours...sometimes 2 hours, sometimes 3.  Then the hour and and second hand would not line up at 12:00 (see photo).  Finally, the thick leather watchband has green rubber coated edges that began to wear off almost immediately (see photo). I'm really disappointed because I need something more stable than the Casio.  Sigh.
summary: Looking for an Atomic Watch? Keep looking.

reviewText: This is a beautiful watch!  I wanted the watch to replace my husband's watches that had died.  My husband Is 83 years old and has dimentia and can no longer figure out the time on a watch face. I needed a digital watch which I forget when ordering this time piece. I wanted a solar atomic watch but forgot a digital readout was also needed. Also, I have set the time to Denver which is in our time zone and the time is consistently incorrect.  I admit that I am probably doing something wrong,but my husband still wears the watch and everyone comments on the style and look of the watch. I still need to find a digital, solar atomic watch.
summary: Great watch, but my 83 year old husband needs a digital watch

reviewText:
Exactly what I was looking for: a reasonably priced, easy to read black , solar power, radio controlled ("Atomic") Watch.  I have several other "atomics"... but my eyes are bad and  I like the readability of this one best.

This is very similar in appearance to a famous German brand solar atomic I also considered briefly, but that one was literally 10x the price.  Reception of the Colorado based atomic radio signal is challenged where I live (NJ) but it seems to be received with little difficulty lying on my window sill after midnight when the skies are clear.  Month, Day, second hand, Time Zone, DST setting and tower reception confirmation info ... all  work perfectly. Very happy with it (owned for 3 weeks so far).
summary: Solar Atomic Watch.... it's  a good one

reviewText:
The watch is what I expected, solar powered, adjusts to

type strap.
I love this watch!  And yes, I would purchase it again.

Many surprising features not mentioned in the add. For instance, the crown allows for precise alignment/sync of the hands to the digital time.
For the analytical fanatic.
